subject: Re: [junit] .AssertionFailedError
msgSnippet: Hi, does your test method name start with test and is your method public? e.g. testInvalidInt() Regards Toyin smatalonga
messageBody:
Hi,

does your test method name start with test and is your method public?

e.g.

testInvalidInt()

Regards

Toyin



"smatalonga"
<smatalonga@adin To: junit@yahoogroups.com
et.com.uy> cc:
Fax to:
06.06.2002 22:18 Subject: [junit] .AssertionFailedError
Please respond
to junit






Hi, I'm new to the groups and to JUnit.

I've been reading the FAQ and the message archive but could not find
an answer for my problem.

I hava a methad which throws an Exception.

I've made a test which follows the recomendation of the fact.

try{
int invalidInt = -1;
MyClass c = new myClass(invalidInt);
fail("Should've thrown MyCLassException");
}
catch(MyClassException mce){}
catch(Exception e)
{
fail("Should never throw exception other than MyClassException");
}

SO far so good, but when I run the test I get:
"
There was 1 failure:

1) warning(junit.framework.TestSuite$1)
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: No tests found in
obligatorio.CartaTest



FAILURES!!!

Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0
"

I'm working with Jbuilder 6.

Thanks, And I apologiice If this issue has already been answered.
Mata
